risks.name: ReleaseDataWithHyphenPrefix
risks.message: Clusters updating out of 4.10.16 may, depending on their past history, fail to initiate the update to any later release.  In order to avoid this trouble, we recommend avoiding updates to this release.  The linked solution includes steps to avoid the issue if you do decide to update to 4.10.16.

risks.name: AWSOldBootImagesLackAfterburn
risks.message: 4.1 AWS boot images are not compatible with some 4.11 and later, and machines created with them will fail to become nodes.  This risk does not apply if a cluster is not on AWS, was installed as version 4.2 or later, or otherwise uses 4.2 or later boot images.

risks.name: KeepalivedMulticastSkew
risks.message: On OpenStack, oVirt, and vSphere infrastructure, updates to 4.11 can cause degraded cluster operators as a result of a multicast-to-unicast keepalived transition, until all nodes have updated to 4.11.

promql.promql: max( cluster_infrastructure_provider{_id="",type=~"OpenStack|oVirt|VSphere"} or 0 * cluster_infrastructure_provider{_id=""} ) * ( group(topk by (node) (1, mcd_update_state{_id="",config!~"|rendered-master-.*"})) or 0 * group(mcd_update_state{_id=""}) )

risks.name: MachineConfigRenderingChurn
risks.message: Clusters with KubletConfigs that do not set 'CSIMigrationOpenStack: true' should remain on 4.10 until they can update to a 4.11 that contains a fix.  Clusters that do not contain any KubeletConfigs are unlikely to be exposed.

risks.name: ARM64SecCompError524
risks.message: 4.11.3 arm64 nodes may expose container creation to seccomp error 524.

risks.name: StaleInsightsRunLevelLabel
risks.message: An 'openshift.io/run-level: 1' annotation on the openshift-insights namespace may cause "container has runAsNonRoot" for the insights operator when updating to 4.11.3.

risks.name: StaleSELinuxPolicies
risks.message: Custom SELinux policies, such as those installed by OpenShift Virtualization, may result in kubelet issues when updating to 4.11.3.

risks.name: OpenStackNodeCreationFails
risks.message: Adding new nodes to the existing cluster on OpenStack will fail.

risks.name: AWSOldBootImagesLackAfterburn
risks.message: 4.1 AWS boot images are not compatible with some 4.11 and later, and machines created with them will fail to become nodes.  This risk does not apply if a cluster is not on AWS, was installed as version 4.2 or later, or otherwise uses 4.2 or later boot images.

risks.name: KeepalivedMulticastSkew
risks.message: On OpenStack, oVirt, and vSphere infrastructure, updates to 4.11 can cause degraded cluster operators as a result of a multicast-to-unicast keepalived transition, until all nodes have updated to 4.11.

promql.promql: max( cluster_infrastructure_provider{_id="",type=~"OpenStack|oVirt|VSphere"} or 0 * cluster_infrastructure_provider{_id=""} ) * ( group(topk by (node) (1, mcd_update_state{_id="",config!~"|rendered-master-.*"})) or 0 * group(mcd_update_state{_id=""}) )

risks.name: MachineConfigRenderingChurn
risks.message: Clusters with KubletConfigs that do not set 'CSIMigrationOpenStack: true' should remain on 4.10 until they can update to a 4.11 that contains a fix.  Clusters that do not contain any KubeletConfigs are unlikely to be exposed.

risks.name: ARM64SecCompError524
risks.message: 4.11.25 arm64 nodes may expose container creation to seccomp error 524.

risks.name: CephParallelFsync
risks.message: This update would introduce a CephFS kernel driver regression, exposing a kernel panic when workloads make parallel ceph_fsync calls to the same file.  The update also introduces many bug fixes as described in the errata, so weigh those against the risk of Ceph kernel panics when deciding whether to update or wait for an OpenShift release that also fixes the Ceph regression.

risks.name: ReleaseDataWithHyphenPrefix
risks.message: Clusters updating out of 4.10.14 may, depending on their past history, fail to initiate the update to any later release.  In order to avoid this trouble, we recommend avoiding updates to this release.  The linked solution includes steps to avoid the issue if you do decide to update to 4.10.14.

risks.name: BrokenBaremetalProvisioning
risks.message: The target release fails to provision and de-provision new baremetal machines required for scaling of a cluster.

promql.promql:
group(cluster_infrastructure_provider{type="BareMetal"})
or
0 * group(cluster_infrastructure_provider)

risks.name: NetPolicyTimeoutsHostNetworkedPodTraffic
risks.message:
Clusters where Ingress Controller uses HostNetwork endpoint publishing strategy and certain NetworkPolicy configurations
may experience network traffic disruptions in namespaces that allowed traffic before the upgrade.

promql.promql:
topk by (_id) (1,
  group by (_id, type) (cluster_infrastructure_provider{_id="",type=~"None|BareMetal|VSphere|OpenStack|Nutanix|Libvirt|KubeVirt|EquinixMetal|External"})
  or
  0 * group by (_id, type) (cluster_infrastructure_provider{_id=""})
)
* on (_id) group_left (resource)
topk by (_id) (1,
  group(max_over_time(apiserver_storage_objects{_id="",resource="networkpolicies.networking.k8s.io"}[1h]) > 0)
  or
  0 * group(max_over_time(apiserver_storage_objects{_id=""}[1h]))
)

risks.name: AWSOldBootImagesLackAfterburn
risks.message: 4.1 AWS boot images are not compatible with some 4.11 and later, and machines created with them will fail to become nodes.  This risk does not apply if a cluster is not on AWS, was installed as version 4.2 or later, or otherwise uses 4.2 or later boot images.

risks.name: KeepalivedMulticastSkew
risks.message: On OpenStack, oVirt, and vSphere infrastructure, updates to 4.11 can cause degraded cluster operators as a result of a multicast-to-unicast keepalived transition, until all nodes have updated to 4.11.

promql.promql: max( cluster_infrastructure_provider{_id="",type=~"OpenStack|oVirt|VSphere"} or 0 * cluster_infrastructure_provider{_id=""} ) * ( group(topk by (node) (1, mcd_update_state{_id="",config!~"|rendered-master-.*"})) or 0 * group(mcd_update_state{_id=""}) )

risks.name: MachineConfigRenderingChurn
risks.message: Clusters with KubletConfigs that do not set 'CSIMigrationOpenStack: true' should remain on 4.10 until they can update to a 4.11 that contains a fix.  Clusters that do not contain any KubeletConfigs are unlikely to be exposed.

risks.name: ARM64SecCompError524
risks.message: 4.11.1 arm64 nodes may expose container creation to seccomp error 524.

risks.name: RPMOSTreeTimeout
risks.message: Nodes with substantial numbers of containers and CPU contention may not reconcile machine configuration

risks.name: StaleInsightsRunLevelLabel
risks.message: An 'openshift.io/run-level: 1' annotation on the openshift-insights namespace may cause "container has runAsNonRoot" for the insights operator when updating to 4.11.1.

risks.name: StaleSELinuxPolicies
risks.message: Custom SELinux policies, such as those installed by OpenShift Virtualization, may result in kubelet issues when updating to 4.11.1.

risks.name: RHELKernelHighLoadIOWait
risks.message: After rebooting into kernel-4.18.0-372.88.1.el8_6 or later, kernel nodes experience high load average and io_wait times. The nodes might fail to start or stop pods and probes may fail. Workload and host processes may become unresponsive and workload may be disrupted.

risks.name: ConsoleAvailableUpdatesNull
risks.message: An administrator console regression breaks the cluster settings page when 'availableUpdates' is null and 'Upgradeable' is 'False'.  You can still use 'oc adm upgrade', address the 'Upgradeable' issues, or wait for a fixed release.

risks.name: OVNCrashOnMigratedDualStack
risks.message: OVN-K8S will keep crashing on clusters that were migrated to dual-stack in their lifetime

risks.name: OldBootImagesPodmanMissingAuthFlag
risks.message: OCP 4.12 started using --authfile flag with podman to perform in-place upgrade on nodes and it does not work with nodes installed with OCP 4.1 version. This risk does not apply if a cluster was installed with version 4.2 or later.

risks.name: PatchesOlderRelease
risks.message: The 4.12.12 release only resolves an installation issue https://issues.redhat.com//browse/OCPBUGS-11662 , which does not affect already running clusters. 4.12.12 does not include fixes delivered in recent 4.11.z and 4.12.z releases and therefore upgrading from these versions would cause fixed bugs to reappear. Red Hat does not recommend upgrading clusters to 4.12.12 version for this reason.

risks.name: AWSOldBootImagesLackAfterburn
risks.message: 4.1 AWS boot images are not compatible with some 4.11 and later, and machines created with them will fail to become nodes.  This risk does not apply if a cluster is not on AWS, was installed as version 4.2 or later, or otherwise uses 4.2 or later boot images.

risks.name: KeepalivedMulticastSkew
risks.message: On OpenStack, oVirt, and vSphere infrastructure, updates to 4.11 can cause degraded cluster operators as a result of a multicast-to-unicast keepalived transition, until all nodes have updated to 4.11.

promql.promql: max( cluster_infrastructure_provider{_id="",type=~"OpenStack|oVirt|VSphere"} or 0 * cluster_infrastructure_provider{_id=""} ) * ( group(topk by (node) (1, mcd_update_state{_id="",config!~"|rendered-master-.*"})) or 0 * group(mcd_update_state{_id=""}) )

risks.name: MachineConfigRenderingChurn
risks.message: Clusters with KubletConfigs that do not set 'CSIMigrationOpenStack: true' should remain on 4.10 until they can update to a 4.11 that contains a fix.  Clusters that do not contain any KubeletConfigs are unlikely to be exposed.

risks.name: ARM64SecCompError524
risks.message: 4.11.5 arm64 nodes may expose container creation to seccomp error 524.

risks.name: DualStackNeedsController
risks.message: Upgrade can get stuck on clusters that use multiple networks together with dual stack.

risks.name: MultiNetworkAttachmentsWhereaboutsVersion
risks.message: Upgrade can get stuck on clusters that have multiple network attachments.

promql.promql: group(network_attachment_definition_instances > 0) or 0 * group(network_attachment_definition_instances)

risks.name: HighNodeStatusReportFrequency
risks.message: An unintended reversion to the default kubelet nodeStatusReportFrequency can cause significant load on the control plane.

risks.name: RHELKernelHighLoadIOWait
risks.message: After rebooting into kernel-4.18.0-372.88.1.el8_6 or later, kernel nodes experience high load average and io_wait times. The nodes might fail to start or stop pods and probes may fail. Workload and host processes may become unresponsive and workload may be disrupted.

risks.name: DuplicateRelease
risks.message: 4.11.23 was replaced with 4.11.24. Please update to 4.11.24, it is an identical release except for the errata link.

risks.name: OVNCrashOnMigratedDualStack
risks.message: OVN-K8S will keep crashing on clusters that were migrated to dual-stack in their lifetime

risks.name: OldBootImagesPodmanMissingAuthFlag
risks.message: OCP 4.12 started using --authfile flag with podman to perform in-place upgrade on nodes and it does not work with nodes installed with OCP 4.1 version. This risk does not apply if a cluster was installed with version 4.2 or later.

risks.name: LeakedMachineConfigBlocksMCO
risks.message: Machine Config Operator stalls when encountering orphaned KubeletConfig or ContainerRuntimeConfig resources.

risks.name: OVNKubeMasterDSPrestop
risks.message: Upgrades can get stuck on OVN clusters that were installed as 4.10 or earlier.

promql.promql: topk(1, label_replace(group(cluster_version{type="initial",version=~"4[.]([0-9]|10)[.].*"}),"born_by_4_10", "yes, born in 4.10 or earlier", "", "") or label_replace(0 * group(cluster_version{type="initial",version!~"4[.]([0-9]|10)[.].*"}),"born_by_4_10", "no, born in 4.11 or later", "", "") ) * on () group_left(resource) ( group by (resource) (max_over_time(apiserver_storage_objects{_id="",resource="egressips.k8s.ovn.org"}[1h])) or on () 0 * group(max_over_time(apiserver_storage_objects{_id=""}[1h])) )

risks.name: OldBootImagesPodmanMissingAuthFlag
risks.message: OCP 4.12 started using --authfile flag with podman to perform in-place upgrade on nodes and it does not work with nodes installed with OCP 4.1 version. This risk does not apply if a cluster was installed with version 4.2 or later.

risks.name: ARM64SecCompError524
risks.message: 4.11.22 arm64 nodes may expose container creation to seccomp error 524.

risks.name: CephCapDropPanic
risks.message: Nodes in clusters running workloads that mount Ceph volumes may experience kernel panics due to a CephFS client bug.

promql.promql:
topk(1,
  label_replace(group(ceph_health_status{_id=""}), "ceph", "yes", "", "")
  or
  label_replace(0 * group(cluster_version{_id=""}), "ceph", "no", "", "")
)

risks.name: AMD19hFirmware
risks.message: Nodes with AMD 19h family CPUs  (Bergamo, Milan, etc.) can fail to boot after applying operating system updates.

promql.promql: topk(1, group by (vendor, family) (node_cpu_info{_id="",vendor="AuthenticAMD",family="25"}) or 0 * group by (vendor, family) (node_cpu_info{_id=""}) )

risks.name: NetPolicyTimeoutsHostNetworkedPodTraffic
risks.message:
Clusters where Ingress Controller uses HostNetwork endpoint publishing strategy and certain NetworkPolicy configurations
may experience network traffic disruptions in namespaces that allowed traffic before the upgrade.

promql.promql:
topk by (_id) (1,
  group by (_id, type) (cluster_infrastructure_provider{_id="",type=~"None|BareMetal|VSphere|OpenStack|Nutanix|Libvirt|KubeVirt|EquinixMetal|External"})
  or
  0 * group by (_id, type) (cluster_infrastructure_provider{_id=""})
)
* on (_id) group_left (resource)
topk by (_id) (1,
  group(max_over_time(apiserver_storage_objects{_id="",resource="networkpolicies.networking.k8s.io"}[1h]) > 0)
  or
  0 * group(max_over_time(apiserver_storage_objects{_id=""}[1h]))
)

risks.name: CephParallelFsync
risks.message: This update would introduce a CephFS kernel driver regression, exposing a kernel panic when workloads make parallel ceph_fsync calls to the same file.  The update also introduces many bug fixes as described in the errata, so weigh those against the risk of Ceph kernel panics when deciding whether to update or wait for an OpenShift release that also fixes the Ceph regression.

risks.name: KeepalivedMulticastSkew
risks.message: On OpenStack, oVirt, and vSphere infrastructure, updates to 4.11 can cause degraded cluster operators as a result of a multicast-to-unicast keepalived transition, until all nodes have updated to 4.11.

promql.promql: max( cluster_infrastructure_provider{_id="",type=~"OpenStack|oVirt|VSphere"} or 0 * cluster_infrastructure_provider{_id=""} ) * ( group(topk by (node) (1, mcd_update_state{_id="",config!~"|rendered-master-.*"})) or 0 * group(mcd_update_state{_id=""}) )

risks.name: MachineConfigRenderingChurn
risks.message: Clusters with KubletConfigs that do not set 'CSIMigrationOpenStack: true' should remain on 4.10 until they can update to a 4.11 that contains a fix.  Clusters that do not contain any KubeletConfigs are unlikely to be exposed.

risks.name: ARM64SecCompError524
risks.message: 4.11.4 arm64 nodes may expose container creation to seccomp error 524.

risks.name: StaleInsightsRunLevelLabel
risks.message: An 'openshift.io/run-level: 1' annotation on the openshift-insights namespace may cause "container has runAsNonRoot" for the insights operator when updating to 4.11.4.

risks.name: AWSOldBootImagesLackAfterburn
risks.message: 4.1 AWS boot images are not compatible with some 4.11 and later, and machines created with them will fail to become nodes.  This risk does not apply if a cluster is not on AWS, was installed as version 4.2 or later, or otherwise uses 4.2 or later boot images.

risks.name: KeepalivedMulticastSkew
risks.message: On OpenStack, oVirt, and vSphere infrastructure, updates to 4.11 can cause degraded cluster operators as a result of a multicast-to-unicast keepalived transition, until all nodes have updated to 4.11.

promql.promql: max( cluster_infrastructure_provider{_id="",type=~"OpenStack|oVirt|VSphere"} or 0 * cluster_infrastructure_provider{_id=""} ) * ( group(topk by (node) (1, mcd_update_state{_id="",config!~"|rendered-master-.*"})) or 0 * group(mcd_update_state{_id=""}) )

risks.name: MachineConfigRenderingChurn
risks.message: Clusters with KubletConfigs that do not set 'CSIMigrationOpenStack: true' should remain on 4.10 until they can update to a 4.11 that contains a fix.  Clusters that do not contain any KubeletConfigs are unlikely to be exposed.

risks.name: ARM64SecCompError524
risks.message: 4.11.12 arm64 nodes may expose container creation to seccomp error 524.

risks.name: AWSOldBootImagesLackAfterburn
risks.message: 4.1 AWS boot images are not compatible with some 4.11 and later, and machines created with them will fail to become nodes.  This risk does not apply if a cluster is not on AWS, was installed as version 4.2 or later, or otherwise uses 4.2 or later boot images.

risks.name: KeepalivedMulticastSkew
risks.message: On OpenStack, oVirt, and vSphere infrastructure, updates to 4.11 can cause degraded cluster operators as a result of a multicast-to-unicast keepalived transition, until all nodes have updated to 4.11.

promql.promql: max( cluster_infrastructure_provider{_id="",type=~"OpenStack|oVirt|VSphere"} or 0 * cluster_infrastructure_provider{_id=""} ) * ( group(topk by (node) (1, mcd_update_state{_id="",config!~"|rendered-master-.*"})) or 0 * group(mcd_update_state{_id=""}) )

risks.name: MachineConfigRenderingChurn
risks.message: Clusters with KubletConfigs that do not set 'CSIMigrationOpenStack: true' should remain on 4.10 until they can update to a 4.11 that contains a fix.  Clusters that do not contain any KubeletConfigs are unlikely to be exposed.

risks.name: ARM64SecCompError524
risks.message: 4.11.0 arm64 nodes may expose container creation to seccomp error 524.

risks.name: RPMOSTreeTimeout
risks.message: Nodes with substantial numbers of containers and CPU contention may not reconcile machine configuration

risks.name: StaleInsightsRunLevelLabel
risks.message: An 'openshift.io/run-level: 1' annotation on the openshift-insights namespace may cause "container has runAsNonRoot" for the insights operator when updating to 4.11.0.

risks.name: StaleSELinuxPolicies
risks.message: Custom SELinux policies, such as those installed by OpenShift Virtualization, may result in kubelet issues when updating to 4.11.0.

risks.name: PodmanTermStorageCorruption
risks.message: BareMetal, Nutanix, OpenStack, oVirt, and VSphere platforms may fail to update nodes in environments where it takes over 20 seconds to retrieve the Machine Config Daemon image.

risks.name: OVNNetworkPolicyLongName
risks.message: A regression may lead to OVN control plane failure and workload disruption when updating to 4.11.8.

risks.name: AMD19hFirmware
risks.message: Nodes with AMD 19h family CPUs  (Bergamo, Milan, etc.) can fail to boot after applying operating system updates.

promql.promql: topk(1, group by (vendor, family) (node_cpu_info{_id="",vendor="AuthenticAMD",family="25"}) or 0 * group by (vendor, family) (node_cpu_info{_id=""}) )

risks.name: OVNKubeMasterDSPrestop
risks.message: Upgrades can get stuck on OVN clusters that were installed as 4.10 or earlier.

promql.promql: topk(1, label_replace(group(cluster_version{type="initial",version=~"4[.]([0-9]|10)[.].*"}),"born_by_4_10", "yes, born in 4.10 or earlier", "", "") or label_replace(0 * group(cluster_version{type="initial",version!~"4[.]([0-9]|10)[.].*"}),"born_by_4_10", "no, born in 4.11 or later", "", "") ) * on () group_left(resource) ( group by (resource) (max_over_time(apiserver_storage_objects{_id="",resource="egressips.k8s.ovn.org"}[1h])) or on () 0 * group(max_over_time(apiserver_storage_objects{_id=""}[1h])) )

risks.name: OVNNetworkPolicyLongName
risks.message: A regression may lead to OVN control plane failure and workload disruption when updating to 4.11.6.

risks.name: OVNCrashOnMigratedDualStack
risks.message: OVN-K8S will keep crashing on clusters that were migrated to dual-stack in their lifetime

risks.name: LeakedMachineConfigBlocksMCO
risks.message: Machine Config Operator stalls when encountering orphaned KubeletConfig or ContainerRuntimeConfig resources.

risks.name: MultiNetworkAttachmentsWhereaboutsVersion
risks.message: Upgrade can get stuck on clusters that have multiple network attachments.

promql.promql: group(network_attachment_definition_instances > 0) or 0 * group(network_attachment_definition_instances)

risks.name: ReleaseDataWithHyphenPrefix
risks.message: Clusters updating out of 4.10.15 may, depending on their past history, fail to initiate the update to any later release.  In order to avoid this trouble, we recommend avoiding updates to this release.  The linked solution includes steps to avoid the issue if you do decide to update to 4.10.15.

risks.message: A regression may lead to OVN control plane failure and workload disruption when updating to 4.11.7.

risks.name: AMD19hFirmware
risks.message: Nodes with AMD 19h family CPUs  (Bergamo, Milan, etc.) can fail to boot after applying operating system updates.

promql.promql: topk(1, group by (vendor, family) (node_cpu_info{_id="",vendor="AuthenticAMD",family="25"}) or 0 * group by (vendor, family) (node_cpu_info{_id=""}) )

risks.name: RHELKernelHighLoadIOWait
risks.message: After rebooting into kernel-4.18.0-372.88.1.el8_6 or later, kernel nodes experience high load average and io_wait times. The nodes might fail to start or stop pods and probes may fail. Workload and host processes may become unresponsive and workload may be disrupted.

risks.name: CephParallelFsync
risks.message: This update would introduce a CephFS kernel driver regression, exposing a kernel panic when workloads make parallel ceph_fsync calls to the same file.  The update also introduces many bug fixes as described in the errata, so weigh those against the risk of Ceph kernel panics when deciding whether to update or wait for an OpenShift release that also fixes the Ceph regression.

risks.message: Clusters updating out of 4.10.15 may, depending on their past history, fail to initiate the update to any later release. risks.name: HighNodeStatusReportFrequency
risks.message: An unintended reversion to the default kubelet nodeStatusReportFrequency can cause significant load on the control plane.

risks.message: Machine Config Operator stalls when encountering orphaned KubeletConfig or ContainerRuntimeConfig resources.

risks.message: 4.1 AWS boot images are not compatible with some 4.11 and later, and machines created with them will fail to become nodes.  This risk does not apply if a cluster is not on AWS, was installed as version 4.2 or later, or otherwise uses 4.2 or later boot images.

risks.name: MachineConfigRenderingChurn
risks.message: Clusters with KubletConfigs that do not set 'CSIMigrationOpenStack: true' should remain on 4.10 until they can update to a 4.11 that contains a fix.  Clusters that do not contain any KubeletConfigs are unlikely to be exposed.

risks.name: ARM64SecCompError524
risks.message: 4.11.23 arm64 nodes may expose container creation to seccomp error 524.

risks.name: DuplicateRelease
risks.message: 4.11.23 was replaced with 4.11.24. Please update to 4.11.24, it is an identical release except for the errata link.

risks.name: NetPolicyTimeoutsHostNetworkedPodTraffic
risks.message:
Clusters where Ingress Controller uses HostNetwork endpoint publishing strategy and certain NetworkPolicy configurations
may experience network traffic disruptions in namespaces that allowed traffic before the upgrade.

promql.promql:
topk by (_id) (1,
  group by (_id, type) (cluster_infrastructure_provider{_id="",type=~"None|BareMetal|VSphere|OpenStack|Nutanix|Libvirt|KubeVirt|EquinixMetal|External"})
  or
  0 * group by (_id, type) (cluster_infrastructure_provider{_id=""})
)
* on (_id) group_left (resource)
topk by (_id) (1,
  group(max_over_time(apiserver_storage_objects{_id="",resource="networkpolicies.networking.k8s.io"}[1h]) > 0)
  or
  0 * group(max_over_time(apiserver_storage_objects{_id=""}[1h]))
)

risks.name: RHELKernelHighLoadIOWait
risks.message: After rebooting into kernel-4.18.0-372.88.1.el8_6 or later, kernel nodes experience high load average and io_wait times. The nodes might fail to start or stop pods and probes may fail. Workload and host processes may become unresponsive and workload may be disrupted.

risks.name: OldBootImagesPodmanMissingAuthFlag
risks.message: OCP 4.12 started using --authfile flag with podman to perform in-place upgrade on nodes and it does not work with nodes installed with OCP 4.1 version. This risk does not apply if a cluster was installed with version 4.2 or later.

risks.name: LeakedMachineConfigBlocksMCO
risks.message: Machine Config Operator stalls when encountering orphaned KubeletConfig or ContainerRuntimeConfig resources.

The update also introduces many bug fixes as described in the errata, so weigh those against the risk of Ceph kernel panics when deciding whether to update or wait for an OpenShift release that also fixes the Ceph regression.

risks.name: PatchesOlderRelease
risks.message: The 4.11.36 release only resolves an installation issue https://issues.redhat.com//browse/OCPBUGS-11663 , which does not affect already running clusters. 4.11.36 does not include fixes delivered in recent 4.11.z releases and therefore upgrading from these versions would cause fixed bugs to reappear. Red Hat does not recommend upgrading clusters to 4.11.36 version for this reason.
